snippet: Worldwide, a thin profit margin was forecast, and American and Asian airlines were expected to make money.
abstract: International Air Transport Assn nearly doubles its forecast of European airline losses in 2012 to $1.1 billion, and says the worldwide aviation industry will make a total profit of $3 billion on revenue of $631 billion, a 0.5 percent margin, due to high fuel prices; notes American and Asian airlines should profit.
lead_paragraph: Worldwide, a thin profit margin was forecast, and American and Asian airlines were expected to make money.

headline.seo: European Airlines Will Lose $1.1 Billion, Aviation Group Predicts
headline.main: Europe’s Airlines Will Lose $1.1 Billion, Trade Group Predicts
headline.print_headline: Europe’s Airlines Will Lose $1.1 Billion, Trade Group Predicts
